subtitle: Make your baby laugh
title: 4 months old
content:
Your baby is changing quickly. She can make basic sounds. She may even say
something that sounds like ‘Ma-ma’ this month! Don't worry if she doesn't. All
babies develop differently. So far, she has needed your full-time attention.
Now she may be happy amusing herself sometimes. You may find her happily
playing with her hands and feet! At this age, it is good for your baby to be
with loved ones or trusted friends. As she grows, your baby will need to learn
social skills and how to interact with others. Your family will love having a
cuddle! You can give her lots of cuddles when you get back. Even though crying
is still your baby's best form of communication, she is also getting a sense
of humour. Play peek-a-boo with her. See if she laughs when your face appears
from under a blanket. Your baby will start to giggle and smile when you make
funny faces and she will enjoy lots of silliness. She will also enjoy hearing
lots of sounds. Click your tongue, whistle or make animal noises. She will
love it. created by BabyCentre
